TopicTitle: Ussari Space Program! A highly [unstable] modded 64K career from behind the iron kertain!

Articles.Content:
> 
> 
> Comrade Political Officer said:
> 
> 
> Obsolete ethanol technology has been retired in favor of safe, powerful kerosene fuel! Until domestic production can reach full capacity, a number of complete launch vehicles have been sourced from KSC to continue advance into space! Behold, new Krasniyy Ivan-series booster!
> 
> 
> 
> > 
> > 
> > Comrade Political Officer said:
> > 
> > 
> > Greetings Comrades! Is dawn on brand new day! In wake of previous minor launch irregularity, Imperium has declared new policy of DÃƒÂ©tente! No more shall we engage in open competition with industrious but misguided foreigners, now we engage in trade! McKerbal's opens in Kermangrad! Solpugids play 'Wind of Change' in Crimson Square! We shall export ethanol, political rhetoric, and internet videos of bad drivers! We shall import blue jeans, cowboy hats, and ridiculously unhealthy snack foods! And rocket engines...
> >
> 

Spoiler

![4tJ0jrH.png](http://i.imgur.com/4tJ0jrH.png)

Spoiler

> 
> 
> Comrade Political Officer said:
> 
> 
> Krasniyy Ivan based on simplicity and reliability, no more reliance on inefficient, antiquated solid rocket boosters!
> 

![3VDTDfE.png](http://i.imgur.com/3VDTDfE.png)

> 
> 
> Comrade Political Officer said:
> 
> 
> Inaugural launch shall lift Director Kermanev Memorial Space Telescope plus inert test mass, totaling over 6.5 tonnes, well beyond capabilities of Stolitsa launcher
> 

![Pc9q9sH.png](http://i.imgur.com/Pc9q9sH.png)

> 
> 
> Comrade Political Officer said:
> 
> 
> Krasniyy Ivan fully powered by kerosene/liquid oxygen fuel mixture. Primary thrust comes from four LV-T30 engines. New engines are so powerful, output has been detuned to 90%!
> 

![jbr5DgP.png](http://i.imgur.com/jbr5DgP.png)

> 
> 
> Comrade Political Officer said:
> 
> 
> Non-gimballing main engines are augmented by four Coxwain vernier engines for attitude control
> 

![Ewytlzj.png](http://i.imgur.com/Ewytlzj.png)

> 
> 
> Comrade Political Officer said:
> 
> 
> When main fuel tank reaches 60% at approximately 15km altitude, two of four main engines automatically shut down to maintain proper thrust-to-weight ratio for control.
> 

![d8MeSqt.png](http://i.imgur.com/d8MeSqt.png)

> 
> 
> Comrade Political Officer said:
> 
> 
> Stages are separated by ullage motors before single LV-T45, also running on kerolox, ignites.
> 

![1Xq2gU3.png](http://i.imgur.com/1Xq2gU3.png)

> 
> 
> Comrade Political Officer said:
> 
> 
> Fairings are jettisoned at 90km, revealing advanced new Kermanev telecope on top of 4-ton test mass!
> 

![4aQ4oo9.png](http://i.imgur.com/4aQ4oo9.png)

> 
> 
> Comrade Political Officer said:
> 
> 
> Payload is placed into 145x104km orbit at 43\* inclination. With considerable fuel still remaining, second stage is discarded with de-orbit motors. First launch of Krasniyy Ivan is complete success!
> 

![QCVbikL.png](http://i.imgur.com/QCVbikL.png)

> 
> 
> Comrade Political Officer said:
> 
> 
> Kermanev telescope then proceeds under own power to final 1300km orbit, and immediately sends back first orbital picture of Sun..
> 

![Fivri9W.png](http://i.imgur.com/Fivri9W.png)

> 
> 
> Comrade Political Officer said:
> 
> 
> ...possibly burning out sensitive camera equipment.
> 

**Edited <time datetime="2015-12-01T05:30:56Z" title="12/01/2015 05:30  AM" data-short="8 yr">December 1, 2015</time> by CatastrophicFailure**
  
test
This and Manley's RP-0 play through are making me seriously consider giving it a crack....

Wow mentioned in the same breath as Scott Manley ![:blush:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_embarrassed.gif)

But yes, I really can't recommend the upscaled mods enough if you're looking for more challenge in the "easy things" (and I use the term loosely) like just getting into orbit. I'm thinking of having a go at RP-0 myself once 1.1 comes out.

> 
> 
> 
> Extra launch added to the manifest just for GarrisonChisholm
> 
> 
> ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)

> 
> 
> Comrade Political Officer said:
> 
> 
> Greetings Comrades! Maiden flight of Krasniyy Ivan was complete success, but Imperious Academy of Sciences has decided more testing is necessary before booster can be committed to kerballed launch.
> 

Spoiler

> 
> 
> 
> > 
> > 
> > Comrade Political Officer said:
> > 
> > 
> > Second launch of Krasniyy Ivan occurs shortly after dawn on Year 2, Day 228. Launch clamps release after main engines are verified to be running properly.
> > 
> 
> 
> 
> 
> ![4IfZOWA.gif](http://i.imgur.com/4IfZOWA.gif)
> 
> 
> 
> > 
> > 
> > Comrade Political Officer said:
> > 
> > 
> > Payload for launch is Technology Demonstrator 2 package. Rocket is outfitted with numerous sensors and new science payloads to verify performs. Onboard camera provides stunning view of eastern Ussari and Nihacima!
> > 
> 
> 
> 
> 
> ![F8JCU1h.png](http://i.imgur.com/F8JCU1h.png)
> 
> 
> 
> > 
> > 
> > Comrade Political Officer said:
> > 
> > 
> > Fairings are jettisoned just before staging at 89 kilometers. Flight profile is still being dialed in with powerful new lifter! Booster will mostly burn up in atmosphere and land in unpopulated area. Probably.
> > 
> 
> 
> 
> 
> ![B9cWrH4.gif](http://i.imgur.com/B9cWrH4.gif)
> 
> 
> 
> > 
> > 
> > Comrade Political Officer said:
> > 
> > 
> > Here we see upper stage of TDEM-2 assembly. At top is long-term research satellite being launched under contract. Below that is re-entry probe to test landing systems for future Eve mission. Below that is 1-ton lead test mass, and beneath that is 500kg Communication from High Altitude Orbit system.
> > 
> 
> 
> 
> 
> ![mBiKhjc.png](http://i.imgur.com/mBiKhjc.png)
> 
> 
> 
> > 
> > 
> > Comrade Political Officer said:
> > 
> > 
> > Here is shown CHAOS equipment bay and dust collection experiment package attached directly to Krasniyy Ivan second stage.
> > 
> 
> 
> 
> 
> ![PXOUd9x.png](http://i.imgur.com/PXOUd9x.png)
> 
> 
> 
> > 
> > 
> > Comrade Political Officer said:
> > 
> > 
> > Upper stage burns to initial 185x160km orbit at 50\* inclination. Kermangrad Cosmodrome launches will now insert into higher, 50 degree inclination, rather than previous 43 degrees, to avoid downrange population centers and Gytepian territory.
> > 
> 
> 
> 
> 
> ![D4tDzX0.png](http://i.imgur.com/D4tDzX0.png)
> 
> 
> 
> > 
> > 
> > Comrade Political Officer said:
> > 
> > 
> > After initial system check out and science experiments, second stage re-ignites to boost orbit to 650km as specified by contract.
> > 
> 
> 
> 
> 
> ![VshQzFh.png](http://i.imgur.com/VshQzFh.png)
> 
> 
> 
> > 
> > 
> > Comrade Political Officer said:
> > 
> > 
> > Once proper circular orbit is achieved, Kraniyy Ivan spins up for stability, research satellite is released and communications verified.
> > 
> 
> 
> 
> 
> ![Nejej6J.png](http://i.imgur.com/Nejej6J.png)
> 
> 
> 
> ![9vDmAau.gif](http://i.imgur.com/9vDmAau.gif)
> 
> 
> 
> > 
> > 
> > Comrade Political Officer said:
> > 
> > 
> > Upper stage has limited hydrazine attitude control fuel and so must maneuver conservatively. After satellite release, engine is refired again and perikee dropped to 200km. Results from science experiments are loaded into experimental data-return hard drive in re-entry probe for recovery on Kerbin. Re-entry maneuver is calculated, and Krasniyy Ivan moves to proper attitude before again spinning up and releasing return probe. Return probe will fire small de-orbit motors at proper time.
> > 
> 
> 
> 
> 
> ![D3LaBPq.gif](http://i.imgur.com/D3LaBPq.gif)
> 
> 
> 
> > 
> > 
> > Comrade Political Officer said:
> > 
> > 
> > Meanwhile, at lowest latitude of 50 degree orbit, second stage engine fires for fourth time and burns remaining fuel to exhaustion, resulting in 1500x200km orbit with apokee high over northern hemisphere. High inclination and long range omnidirectional antenna will provide excellent communication coverage for future missions, including coverage of Kerbin's north pole. Lightweight CHAOS system will be launched aboard all flights with available payload mass for minimal cost over initial launch price. Due to high inclination of launch site, orbits will naturally be of much greater variety than equatorial launches, so space debris is of minor concern. High-altitude pseudo-kolinaya oribts also more efficient than massive cost of geostationary network.
> > 
> 
> 
> 
> 
> ![kGh1Mb1.png](http://i.imgur.com/kGh1Mb1.png)
>

> 
> 
> 
>  
> 
> 
> 
> 
> > 
> > 
> > Comrade Political Officer said:
> > 
> > 
> > Unfortunately, re-entry probe developed problems shortly after separation and contact was lost. Engineers are currently pouring over limited data returns, but are suspecting a NullReferenceException error lead to a Critical Existence Failure. With primary goals accomplished, mission is still considered impressive success.
> > 
> 
> 
> 
> 
>  
> 
> 

**Edited <time datetime="2015-12-01T05:32:15Z" title="12/01/2015 05:32  AM" data-short="8 yr">December 1, 2015</time> by CatastrophicFailure**
  
ARGH IMGUR!

> 
> 
> > 
> > Extra launch added to the manifest just for GarrisonChisholm
> > ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)
> 

...wow, that was.. so awesome. ...like a Boston-creme doughnut to a diabetic... ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif) - Thank you!

> 
> <iframe width="459" height="344" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/ALb9ti0lZKM?feature=oembed" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen="true"></iframe>

...I just had to watch this again. ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif) -- too good.

only 1 more day of night-shift!

I am pretty happy with how that turned out, actually. I usually lack the patience (and skill) for videos, but maybe I'll have to throw the odd one in the mix. I'm going in to the doctor to get declawed in a few hours, then I'm off for a full week, so I'm hoping for lots of updates then!

I love what you are doing here. The designs are inspiring and the wacky setting is endearing.

I hope you keep this up and help populate the x6.4 report section. I mean, it's only one step away from RSS, where the big boys play ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif)

> 
> 
> Comrade Political Officer said:
> 
> 
> Greetings Comrades! Today we gather to celebrate historic flight of Tercella Kerman, first Ussari in orbit! Old technology has been left by side of road, brave Tercella's spacecraft has been mounted to modern, reliable, Krasniyy Ivan booster!
> 

Spoiler

![Upxp8Xf.png](http://i.imgur.com/Upxp8Xf.png)

> 
> 
> Comrade Political Officer said:
> 
> 
> As always, pair of engines shut down at 60% kerosene remaining, to maintain proper TWR for control in middle atmosphere.
> 

![VnSnqqY.png](http://i.imgur.com/VnSnqqY.png)

> 
> 
> Comrade Political Officer said:
> 
> 
> Once fully depleted, first stage separates at approximately 70 kilometers. Flight profile has been optimized for single LV-T45 Swivel engine and low (.90) initial TWR.
> 

![RM5nLM9.png](http://i.imgur.com/RM5nLM9.png)

> 
> 
> Comrade Political Officer said:
> 
> 
> Once free of atmosphere, heavy launch escape tower is jettisoned.
> 

![EnMlKkG.png](http://i.imgur.com/EnMlKkG.png)

> 
> 
> Comrade Political Officer said:
> 
> 
> Despite challenge and adversity, after flawless launch Ussari Space Program has finally achieved goal of putting Kerbal in space!
> 

![3w1FWvy.gif](http://i.imgur.com/3w1FWvy.gif)

> 
> 
> Comrade Political Officer said:
> 
> 
> Brave Tercella's pod is placed into final orbit of 151x118km at 43\* inclination and mission is cleared for at least five orbits! After battery of initial science experiments and diplomatic exchange as craft passes near Kerbal Space Center, fearless Tercella prepares for next milestone!
> 

![H1n2Z0W.png](http://i.imgur.com/H1n2Z0W.png)

![6wf1TBG.png](http://i.imgur.com/6wf1TBG.png)

> 
> 
> Comrade Political Officer said:
> 
> 
> During next pass over Kermangrad Cosmodrome, Tercella embarks on record-setting extra-vehicular activity, remaining outside of capsule for some twenty minutes and performing numerous highly successful experiments and equipment tests. Television footage from on-board camera beamed back to Kerbin will no doubt become famous historical document!
> 

![cB3vIax.gif](http://i.imgur.com/cB3vIax.gif)

> 
> 
> Comrade Political Officer said:
> 
> 
> After numerous successes during historic EVA, brave Tercella begins planned reentry procedure on third orbit while passing over traitorous rebel province of South Erakonia
> 

![3dcwaOr.gif](http://i.imgur.com/3dcwaOr.gif)

![FbPGE3H.gif](http://i.imgur.com/FbPGE3H.gif)

> 
> 
> Comrade Political Officer said:
> 
> 
> Following uneventful reentry, stalwart Tercella lands softly on bank of Vulgar River, not far from Cosmodrome!
> 

![xFWSNsu.png](http://i.imgur.com/xFWSNsu.png)

> 
> 
> Comrade Political Officer said:
> 
> 
> Having surmounted great challenges, dream of putting Ussari in space and returning them safely to Kerbin has finally been realized! From this humble beginning Glorious Ussari Union will no doubt maintain status as world leader of space innovation!
> 
> 
> In very short time, brave Dibella Kermanov shall continue to set records by becoming first Kerbal to fly in space twice, on endurance-testing three-day flight!
> 

**Edited <time datetime="2015-12-01T05:33:25Z" title="12/01/2015 05:33  AM" data-short="8 yr">December 1, 2015</time> by CatastrophicFailure**

Too, too cool. Many thumbs up. (meta-hominid)

\*gifts billions of *Krubles* to Ussari Cosmodrome for accelerated production of fascinating documentary videos\*

> 
> 
>

> 
> 
>

> 
>

> >

> 
> 
> 
> ![lGXhmdT.png](http://i.imgur.com/lGXhmdT.png)

**Edited <time datetime="2015-12-01T05:35:43Z" title="12/01/2015 05:35  AM" data-short="8 yr">December 1, 2015</time> by CatastrophicFailure**

Wow, that is certainly an asteroid invasion you have there, is that 5 of them? or are some of those elliptical grey traces craft/debris leaving Kerbin SOI?

I use custom asteroids and have yet to even get a single rock approach Kerbin SOI, do you use custom asteroids or are you on the stock spawner?

> 
> I love what you are doing here. The designs are inspiring and the wacky setting is endearing.
> I hope you keep this up and help populate the x6.4 report section. I mean, it's only one step away from RSS, where the big boys play ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif)

Many thanks. I finally got caught up on your own series only to find it's ending ![:(](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_sad.gif)

> 
> Too, too cool. Many thumbs up. (meta-hominid)
> \*gifts billions of *Krubles* to Ussari Cosmodrome for accelerated production of fascinating documentary videos\*

![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif) I've a bit of a backlog ATM so there's lots ahead, and some truly annoying frustrations. ![:mad:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_angry.gif)

> 
> Wow, that is certainly an asteroid invasion you have there, is that 5 of them? or are some of those elliptical grey traces craft/debris leaving Kerbin SOI?
> I use custom asteroids and have yet to even get a single rock approach Kerbin SOI, do you use custom asteroids or are you on the stock spawner?

just stock 'roids. Think I'm up to 6 or 7 now. If I find one wandering thru the system I tend to track & keep it if it's gonna stick around. Much easier than trying to chase one down from escape velocity. ![:cool:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cool.gif)

In development for some time, what was to be experimental launch carrying useless test mass becomes gambit to fulfill contract! CHAOS hardware has been quickly adapted to provide necessary guidance to impact MÃƒÂ¼n with nearly 10 tonnes! Footage has been compiled here to traditional Ussari Naval hymn!

[quote name='Comrade Political Officer']Initial analysis of data confirms that Krasniyy Ivan Ultra will be capable of placing over 20 tonnes in LKO, 6.5 tonnes to TMI, and smaller payloads beyond Kerbin SOI without use of extra transfer stage!  

[quote name='Comrade Political Officer']It is mixed bag however, good Comrades. As planned, Krasniyy Ivan Ultra upper stage successfully impacts MÃƒÂ¼n with 9.5 tonnes of mass remaining, traveling at over 3 kilometers per second only hours before contract expires. But upon searching for carrier signal from MÃƒÂ¼na 8 on surface to begin seismic data transmission, all is silent. Both Tracking Station and orbiting MÃƒÂ¼na 7 are unable to find any trace of lander. It is as if MÃƒÂ¼na 8 has completely disappeared. Further study of this aberration will have to wait, however, as now we must focus on upcoming historic three-day flight of brave Dibella Kermanov!

**Edited <time datetime="2015-12-01T05:39:09Z" title="12/01/2015 05:39  AM" data-short="8 yr">December 1, 2015</time> by CatastrophicFailure**

20 tonnes to LKO? Wow ..... somebody just put the big boy trousers on!!  

As ever another beautiful video, I dont know how long it takes you to do all the camera shots and that (also the custom graphics too) but it is definitely worth the effort! one impressed reader here :)  

Looking at that craft on the pad I would have expected serious wobble between the core and the two boosters flapping about like wings, yet the vid shows them rock steady. The only connections I can see are the separators and a pair of struts at the top, what kind of magic is this??  

Where is your impact experiment coming form? I know Interstellar had one but you are not running that, crashing stuff into stuff is something even I can do!

I spent waaaay to long on that. Took days to collect all the footage (since, like the title says, highly unstable and I get maybe one launch per crash), was worried I wouldn't have enough. Probably could have used the whole song after all. And thanks :cool:  

I use KJR and some upgraded struts from Stock Revamp (I think). At some point Squad fixed their wobbly joints too I thought. More details on the new launcher will come with its next payload.   

Impactor contracts come from the [URL="http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/114087-1-0-Impact!-impact-science-and-contracts-v1-2-0-With-Asteroids-7-9-15"]Impact![/URL] mod. Works with asteroids too!
